byline.contributor: Christopher Mele and Megan Thee-Brenan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA, MITCH SMITH and STEPHANIE SAUL

abstract: University of Chicago sends students arriving for new academic year frank letter opposing moves to curb campus speech; statement, which challenges some hallmarks of campus political correctness, receives thousands of responses on both sides of argument.

keywords.value: Foundation for Individual Rights in Education
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A letter to incoming freshmen professed no support for “trigger warnings” or limits on what kinds of speech should be condoned on campus.

headline.main: University of Chicago Strikes Back Against Campus Political Correctness
headline.print_headline: University of Chicago Rebels Against Moves to Stifle Speech
